arm_group.description: injections of 3.6 mL of 2% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine Intervention: inferior alveolar nerve block injection
injections of 3.6 mL of 2% mepivacaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine Intervention: inferior alveolar nerve block injection
injections of 3.6 mL of 4% articaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine Intervention: inferior alveolar nerve block injection

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study was to compare the anesthetic efficacy of articaine, lidocaine and
      mepivacaine in patients with irreversible pulpitis of mandibular molar.

detailed_description.textblock:
Conventional inferior alveolar nerve block (IANB) is the most commonly used technique for
      achieving pulpal anesthesia in posterior mandibular endodontic procedures. However, IANB has
      a high failure rate and success rates are even lower when applied for the treatment of
      mandibular posterior teeth with irreversible pulpitis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  clinical diagnosis of irreversible pulpitis

          -  good health

          -  had at least 1 adjacent tooth plus a healthy canine

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  took medication could be interacting with any of the anesthetics used

intervention.description: -22 patients received inferior alveolar nerve block injections of 3.6 mL (equivalent to 2 cartridges)
intervention.intervention_name: Intervention: inferior alveolar nerve block injection

facility.name: Emergency Center of the School of Dentistry at the University of São Paulo

clinical_study.official_title: Anesthetic Efficacy of Articaine, Lidocaine and Mepivacaine in Patients With Irreversible Pulpitis of Mandibular Molar

other_outcome.description: The investigators evaluated the subjective lip anethesia by asking the patient whether his/her lip was numb
other_outcome.time_frame: ten minutes after the inferior alveolar nerve block

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.description: pulpal anesthesia was tested with an electric pulp stimulator
primary_outcome.time_frame: Ten minutes after the inferior alveolar nerve block

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the intensity of pain during the pulpectomy a verbal analogic scale was adopted
secondary_outcome.time_frame: the patients were instructed to report any painful sensation at three phases: 1) dentin 2) pulp chamber 3) root canal

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-equivalence Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
